message.content: Since $N = P(N) + S(N)$ we have \[\begin{aligned}N &= P(N) + S(N)\\ &= a+b + ab \end{aligned}\]where the digits of $N$ are $a,b$. Since $10|N$, we have $a+b + ab \equiv 0 \pmod{10}$. The possible values for $ab+a+b$ are $0,10,20,\ldots,90$. The only ones giving single digit $a,b$ are $10,12,18,21,27,30,36,42,48$. Testing shows only $12$ and $18$ satisfy the condition given in the problem. It now remains to find which of $12=a_0 + b_0 + a_0b_0$ or $18 = a_1+b_1+a_1b_1$ is true. This gives $Tom Brady(2008) = \boxed{8}$.
